section.para: This class is an extension of the PluginBroker. It provides the additional ability of allowing the registration of plugin names with related options, for the purposes of allowing lazy-loading of plugins and/or specifying default options.
Typically, a component will define an extension to the PluginSpecBroker. In these cases, you instantiate the broker, optionally providing specifications.
All PluginBroker options are supported, in addition to those listed below.

listitem.para: The value of this option should be an array or Traversable object, containing plugin name/configuration pairs.

section.para: All PluginBroker methods are available. The methods below either differ in capabilities, or are specific to this implementation.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Resolve a plugin name to an object instance

refsect1.title: load()
refsect1.para: This method acts like parent in all ways. However, if a specification has been loaded previously via the constructor, setOptions(), or registerSpec(), those options will be used if $options is null.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Register a plugin specification by name

refsect1.title: registerSpec()
refsect1.para: Registers a plugin specification using the given $name. The specification is simply a set of arguments to pass to the object constructor when first loaded by the broker.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Register many plugin specifications at once

refsect1.title: registerSpecs()
refsect1.para: Registers many plugin specifications at once. $specs must be an array or Traversable object. It is iterated, and the key/value pairs are passed as arguments to registerSpec().

refsect1.title: unregisterSpec()
refsect1.para: If a plugin specficiation referenced by $name has been previously registered, that specification is removed.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Retrieve all registered plugins and specifications

refsect1.title: getRegisteredPlugins()
refsect1.para: Retrieves the names of all loaded plugins, as well as all plugin specifications registered.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Determine if a plugin has been loaded or registered

refsect1.title: hasPlugin()
refsect1.para: Use this method to determine whether or not the plugin by the name of $name has been loaded or registered, or whether or not a plugin specification has been provided.
